programControlMapping.name: Change Management Workflow
programControlMapping.description: The Change Management documentation outlines the internal workflow for propagating application and infrastructure code changes to the production environment, including tracking, testing, reviewing and approving.

subsections.description: Measurable activities for continual improvements are integrated into AI system updates and include regular engagement with interested parties, including relevant AI actors.

programControlMapping.name: Measuring AI system performance
programControlMapping.description: AI system performance and reliability criteria are measured qualitatively or quantitatively as part of the ongoing system usage in production, and performance improvements are identified and implemented according to the company's product development lifecycle.

programControlMapping.name: Customer Feedback Program
programControlMapping.description: A customer feedback program is in place to collect and monitor customer satisfaction and complaints.

subsections.description: Incidents and errors are communicated to relevant AI actors, including affected communities. Processes for tracking, responding to, and recovering from incidents and errors are followed and documented.

programPolicyMapping.title: AI Governance Policy
programPolicyMapping.description: Establish the objectives, practices, and governance around the use of Artificial Intelligence.

subsections.description: Intended purposes, potentially beneficial uses, contextspecific laws, norms and expectations, and prospective settings in which the AI system will be deployed are understood and documented. Considerations include: the specific set or types of users along with their expectations; potential positive and negative impacts of system uses to individuals, communities, organizations, society, and the planet; assumptions and related limitations about AI system purposes, uses, and risks across the development or product AI lifecycle; and related TEVV and system metrics.

programControlMapping.name: AI Risk Management
programControlMapping.description: As part of its Risk Assessment process, the company considers risks associated with its use of AI, and the impact of the company's AI to users, groups, systems, and society.

programControlMapping.name: Responsible Development of AI Systems
programControlMapping.description: The company has identified objectives and processes to ensure the responsible development of AI systems, and integrated those processes into the SDLC life cycle.

subsections.description: Interdisciplinary AI actors, competencies, skills, and capacities for establishing context reflect demographic diversity and broad domain and user experience expertise, and their participation is documented. programControlMapping.name: Interdisciplinary approach to AI
programControlMapping.description: An interdisciplinary approach is established for resources required for the lifecycle of AI systems, reflecting demographic diversity, diverse competencies and skills.

subsections.description: The organization’s mission and relevant goals for AI technology are understood and documented.

programControlMapping.name: AI Mission and Goals
programControlMapping.description: The company's mission and goals for the use of AI are documented in the company's AI Governance Policy.

subsections.description: The business value or context of business use has been clearly defined or – in the case of assessing existing AI systems – re-evaluated.

programControlMapping.name: AI Business Value Assessment
programControlMapping.description: The business value and use of various AI systems is documented, and regular assessments are conducted to reevaluates the value that AI systems are providing to the business.

subsections.description: Organizational risk tolerances are determined and documented.

programControlMapping.name: Risk Register
programControlMapping.description: The company maintains a Cumulative Risk Register storing control deficiencies identified as part of ongoing system reviews, and reviews the register as part of the company's regular Risk Assessment process.

subsections.description: System requirements (e.g., “the system shall respect the privacy of its users”) are elicited from and understood by relevant AI actors. Design decisions take socio-technical implications into account to address AI risks.

programControlMapping.description: The company maintains an inventory of AI systems that includes the system scope, owner, its business use, and knowledge limits, and specific AI methodologies used to implement the AI system.

programControlMapping.description: The organization defines a process to report concerns about the organization’s role with respect to an AI system throughout its life cycle.

programControlMapping.description: The company maintains standards for data quality in AI systems, and has defined procedures for assessing that the data used in AI systems meet those standards.

programControlMapping.name: Human review of AI system outputs
programControlMapping.description: The quality process includes human review of AI system outputs, along with procedures for taking action in the case of a system output failure.

subsections.description: Scientific integrity and TEVV considerations are identified and documented, including those related to experimental design, data collection and selection (e.g., availability, representativeness, suitability), system trustworthiness, and construct validation.

programControlMapping.name: AI data quality
programControlMapping.description: The company maintains standards for data quality in AI systems, and has defined procedures for assessing that the data used in AI systems meet those standards.

programPolicyMapping.title: AI Governance Policy
programPolicyMapping.description: Establish the objectives, practices, and governance around the use of Artificial Intelligence.

subsections.description: Potential benefits of intended AI system functionality and performance are examined and documented.

programControlMapping.name: AI Governance Policy
programControlMapping.description: The company maintains a documented AI Governance Policy governing the use of AI within the organization.

programControlMapping.description: The AI Governance Policy takes into account customer's expectations and needs in regards to the responsible use of AI systems.

programControlMapping.name: Development of AI Systems
programControlMapping.description: The requirements for the development of systems utilizing Artificial intelligence are documented in the company's AI Governance Policy.

subsections.description: Potential costs, including non-monetary costs, which result from expected or realized AI errors or system functionality and trustworthiness – as connected to organizational risk tolerance – are examined and documented.

programControlMapping.name: Risk Register
programControlMapping.description: The company maintains a Cumulative Risk Register storing control deficiencies identified as part of ongoing system reviews, and reviews the register as part of the company's regular Risk Assessment process.

programControlMapping.description: The company maintains a risk management program to identify, prioritize, and mitigate risk to acceptable levels.

subsections.description: Targeted application scope is specified and documented based on the system’s capability, established context, and AI system categorization.

programControlMapping.name: AI Concern Reporting Process
programControlMapping.description: The organization defines a process to report concerns about the organization’s role with respect to an AI system throughout its life cycle.

programControlMapping.name: AI system inventory
programControlMapping.description: The company maintains an inventory of AI systems that includes the system scope, owner, its business use, and knowledge limits, and specific AI methodologies used to implement the AI system.

subsections.description: Processes for operator and practitioner proficiency with AI system performance and trustworthiness – and relevant technical standards and certifications – are defined, assessed, and documented.

programControlMapping.name: AI system operator training
programControlMapping.description: The company conducts training for operators of AI systems to ensure AI system performance and trustworthiness.

subsections.description: Processes for human oversight are defined, assessed, and documented in accordance with organizational policies from the GOVERN function.

programControlMapping.name: AI system human oversight
programControlMapping.description: Process for human oversight of AI systems are defined.

programPolicyMapping.title: Risk Management Policy
programPolicyMapping.description: Establish a framework for managing risk at the company and incorporating risk assessments throughout the company's operations.

programPolicyMapping.title: AI Governance Policy
programPolicyMapping.description: Establish the objectives, practices, and governance around the use of Artificial Intelligence.

subsections.description: Approaches for mapping AI technology and legal risks of its components – including the use of third-party data or software – are in place, followed, and documented, as are risks of infringement of a third party’s intellectual property or other rights.

programControlMapping.name: AI system legal risk management
programControlMapping.description: As part of its Risk Assessment process, the company considers legal risks associated with its AI technology, including risks of use of third party data or software and the risk of infringement of a third party's intellectual property or other rights.

subsections.description: Internal risk controls for components of the AI system, including third-party AI technologies, are identified and documented.

programControlMapping.name: Control selection
programControlMapping.description: The company designs and implements controls to mitigate risks identified during the risk assessment process.

programControlMapping.name: AI adversarial risk assessment
programControlMapping.description: AI adversarial risks from competitors and attackers are regularly assessed as part of the company risk management process.

programPolicyMapping.title: AI Risk Management Policy
programPolicyMapping.description: A framework for managing AI risk at the company.

subsections.description: Likelihood and magnitude of each identified impact (both potentially beneficial and harmful) based on expected use, past uses of AI systems in similar contexts, public incident reports, feedback from those external to the team that developed or deployed the AI system, or other data are identified and documented.

programControlMapping.name: AI system impact scope
programControlMapping.description: The impacts of implemented AI systems, both beneficial and harmful, are regularly assessed according to the company's standard risk management practices.

subsections.description: Practices and personnel for supporting regular engagement with relevant AI actors and integrating feedback about positive, negative, and unanticipated impacts are in place and documented.

programControlMapping.name: Customer Feedback Program
programControlMapping.description: A customer feedback program is in place to collect and monitor customer satisfaction and complaints.

programPolicyMapping.title: AI Governance Policy
programPolicyMapping.description: Establish the objectives, practices, and governance around the use of Artificial Intelligence.

programPolicyMapping.title: AI Risk Management Policy
programPolicyMapping.description: A framework for managing AI risk at the company.

subsections.description: Approaches and metrics for measurement of AI risks enumerated during the MAP function are selected for implementation starting with the most significant AI risks. The risks or trustworthiness characteristics that will not – or cannot – be measured are properly documented.

programControlMapping.name: AI risk tracking
programControlMapping.description: AI risks are measured by approaches and metrics defined as part of the company's standard risk assessment process, are planned for implementation and documented in the company's risk register.  Risks that cannot be measured are noted as such in the register, along with potential alternative risk tracking techniques.

subsections.description: Appropriateness of AI metrics and effectiveness of existing controls are regularly assessed and updated, including reports of errors and potential impacts on affected communities.

programControlMapping.name: AI control review
programControlMapping.description: AI metrics and controls are regularly reviewed and updated, including reports of errors and potential impacts on affected communities.

subsections.description: Internal experts who did not serve as front-line developers for the system and/or independent assessors are involved in regular assessments and updates. Domain experts, users, AI actors external to the team that developed or deployed the AI system, and affected communities are consulted in support of assessments as necessary per organizational risk tolerance.

programControlMapping.name: AI independent validation
programControlMapping.description: AI Systems are regularly assessed by internal experts not part of the development team.

programControlMapping.name: AI external assessment
programControlMapping.description: An external assessment of AI systems, risks, and impacts is conducted annually.

programPolicyMapping.title: AI Governance Policy
programPolicyMapping.description: Establish the objectives, practices, and governance around the use of Artificial Intelligence.

programPolicyMapping.title: AI Risk Management Policy
programPolicyMapping.description: A framework for managing AI risk at the company.

subsections.description: Test sets, metrics, and details about the tools used during TEVV are documented.

programControlMapping.name: AI system inventory
programControlMapping.description: The company maintains an inventory of AI systems that includes the system scope, owner, its business use, and knowledge limits, and specific AI methodologies used to implement the AI system.

programControlMapping.name: AI test sets
programControlMapping.description: Test sets are defined for each AI system, which can be made up of both automated and manual tests, and the tests are regularly conducted throughout the AI system development life cycle.

programControlMapping.name: AI system trustworthiness and reliability metrics
programControlMapping.description: Metrics are defined for the AI system to validate system trustworthiness and reliability, based on inputs from domain experts and relevant AI actors.

programControlMapping.name: AI Concern Reporting Process
programControlMapping.description: The organization defines a process to report concerns about the organization’s role with respect to an AI system throughout its life cycle.

subsections.description: Privacy risk of the AI system – as identified in the MAP function – is examined and documented.

programControlMapping.name: Privacy Impact Review
programControlMapping.description: A privacy assessment that includes a system design and architecture review is performed as part of the SDLC process to gauge the privacy impact.

subsections.description: Fairness and bias – as identified in the MAP function – are evaluated and results are documented

programControlMapping.name: AI system fairness and bias review
programControlMapping.description: Regular evaluations of AI system fairness and potential bias are conducted, and results documented.

subsections.description: Environmental impact and sustainability of AI model training and management activities – as identified in the MAP function – are assessed and documented.

programControlMapping.name: AI system environmental impact
programControlMapping.description: As part of its risk assessment process, the company considers environmental and sustainability risks associated with AI.

subsections.description: Effectiveness of the employed TEVV metrics and processes in the MEASURE function are evaluated and documented.

programControlMapping.name: AI control review
programControlMapping.description: AI metrics and controls are regularly reviewed and updated, including reports of errors and potential impacts on affected communities.

subsections.description: Evaluations involving human subjects meet applicable requirements (including human subject protection) and are representative of the relevant population.

programControlMapping.name: Human testing diversity
programControlMapping.description: Any testing or evaluation involving human subjects ensure that the pool of subjects is representative of the relevant population.

programControlMapping.name: Testing with human subjects
programControlMapping.description: Any testing or evaluation involving human subjects are designed to protect and respect the privacy of the human subjects, are conducted with full knowledge of the scope of the test by the subject(s), and with their full consent.

subsections.description: AI system performance or assurance criteria are measured qualitatively or quantitatively and demonstrated for conditions similar to deployment setting(s). Measures are documented.

programControlMapping.name: Measuring AI system performance
programControlMapping.description: AI system performance and reliability criteria are measured qualitatively or quantitatively as part of the ongoing system usage in production, and performance improvements are identified and implemented according to the company's product development lifecycle.

subsections.description: The functionality and behavior of the AI system and its components – as identified in the MAP function – are monitored when in production.

programControlMapping.name: AI systems logging and monitoring
programControlMapping.description: The company uses logging and monitoring tools to track the usage of AI systems and identify potential issues.

subsections.description: The AI system to be deployed is demonstrated to be valid and reliable. Limitations of the generalizability beyond the conditions under which the technology was developed are documented.

programControlMapping.name: AI Quality Process
programControlMapping.description: A quality process is defined to ensure that AI systems are valid and reliable.  Any limitations to the generalizability beyond the conditions under which the technology was developed are documented.

subsections.description: The AI system is evaluated regularly for safety risks – as identified in the MAP function. The AI system to be deployed is demonstrated to be safe, its residual negative risk does not exceed the risk tolerance, and it can fail safely, particularly if made to operate beyond its knowledge limits. Safety metrics reflect system reliability and robustness, real-time monitoring, and response times for AI system failures.

programControlMapping.name: AI system safety risk management
programControlMapping.description: As part of its risk assessment process, the company considers AI safety risks, and regularly evaluates AI systems against those risks, particularly in cases where AI systems are made to operate beyond its knowledge limits.

subsections.description: AI system security and resilience – as identified in the MAP function – are evaluated and documented.

programControlMapping.name: AI Development Security Assessment
programControlMapping.description: An AI security assessment is conducted for all AI-related product initiatives, to guard against malicious inputs or queries, safeguard integrations with other systems, and to prevent the generation of harmful and malicious content.

programControlMapping.name: Security Team Meetings
programControlMapping.description: The company's Security Team meets regularly to discuss security-related goals that advance the company's business objectives, and plan for the resolution or mitigation of current security risks and incidents.

programControlMapping.name: AI Threat Modeling
programControlMapping.description: The company security team regularly identifies and models threats and examines processes and security defenses related to the use of AI or AI-assisted attacks.

programControlMapping.name: AI PenTesting
programControlMapping.description: Penetration testing is conducted against AI systems at least annually.

programControlMapping.name: SDLC - Security Reviews
programControlMapping.description: Major product changes and new features undergo specialized security reviews and risk assessment by qualified personnel early in the design phase, and as required throughout implementation.

programControlMapping.name: AI Insider Threat Mitigation
programControlMapping.description: The company has implemented insider threat mitigation to prevent misuse of AI systems by authorized users.

subsections.description: Risks associated with transparency and accountability – as identified in the MAP function – are examined and documented.

programControlMapping.name: AI system transparency and accountability risk management
programControlMapping.description: As part of its risk assessment process, the company considers risks associated with AI transparency and accountability.

subsections.description: The AI model is explained, validated, and documented, and AI system output is interpreted within its context – as identified in the MAP function – to inform responsible use and governance.

programControlMapping.name: AI model inventory
programControlMapping.description: AI models used for AI systems are explained, validated, and included in the AI System Inventory, and AI system output is interpreted within its context.

programPolicyMapping.title: Change Management Policy
programPolicyMapping.description: Provide guidance on the process of managing change across company critical systems and products.

programPolicyMapping.title: Software Development Lifecycle Policy
programPolicyMapping.description: Software Development Lifecycle Policy

programPolicyMapping.title: AI Governance Policy
programPolicyMapping.description: Establish the objectives, practices, and governance around the use of Artificial Intelligence.

programPolicyMapping.title: AI Risk Management Policy
programPolicyMapping.description: A framework for managing AI risk at the company.

subsections.description: Approaches, personnel, and documentation are in place to regularly identify and track existing, unanticipated, and emergent AI risks based on factors such as intended and actual performance in deployed contexts

programControlMapping.name: Support channel
programControlMapping.description: External users are provided with a support channel for reporting systems failures, incidents, concerns, and other complaints to appropriate personnel.

programControlMapping.name: Internal Support Channel
programControlMapping.description: Employees have access to an internal support channel that can be used to report incidents, concerns, and complaints.

programControlMapping.name: AI Risk Management
programControlMapping.description: As part of its Risk Assessment process, the company considers risks associated with its use of AI, and the impact of the company's AI to users, groups, systems, and society.

programControlMapping.name: Customer Feedback Program
programControlMapping.description: A customer feedback program is in place to collect and monitor customer satisfaction and complaints.

subsections.description: Risk tracking approaches are considered for settings where AI risks are difficult to assess using currently available measurement techniques or where metrics are not yet available.

programControlMapping.name: AI risk tracking
programControlMapping.description: AI risks are measured by approaches and metrics defined as part of the company's standard risk assessment process, are planned for implementation and documented in the company's risk register.  Risks that cannot be measured are noted as such in the register, along with potential alternative risk tracking techniques.

subsections.description: Feedback processes for end users and impacted communities to report problems and appeal system outcomes are established and integrated into AI system evaluation metrics.

programControlMapping.name: Customer Feedback Program
programControlMapping.description: A customer feedback program is in place to collect and monitor customer satisfaction and complaints.

programControlMapping.name: AI system impact scope
programControlMapping.description: The impacts of implemented AI systems, both beneficial and harmful, are regularly assessed according to the company's standard risk management practices.

programPolicyMapping.title: AI Governance Policy
programPolicyMapping.description: Establish the objectives, practices, and governance around the use of Artificial Intelligence.

programPolicyMapping.title: AI Risk Management Policy
programPolicyMapping.description: A framework for managing AI risk at the company.

subsections.description: Measurement approaches for identifying AI risks are connected to deployment context(s) and informed through consultation with domain experts and other end users. Approaches are documented.

programControlMapping.name: AI risk tracking
programControlMapping.description: AI risks are measured by approaches and metrics defined as part of the company's standard risk assessment process, are planned for implementation and documented in the company's risk register.  Risks that cannot be measured are noted as such in the register, along with potential alternative risk tracking techniques.

subsections.description: Measurement results regarding AI system trustworthiness in deployment context(s) and across the AI lifecycle are informed by input from domain experts and relevant AI actors to validate whether the system is performing consistently as intended. Results are documented.

programControlMapping.name: AI system trustworthiness and reliability metrics
programControlMapping.description: Metrics are defined for the AI system to validate system trustworthiness and reliability, based on inputs from domain experts and relevant AI actors.

subsections.description: Measurable performance improvements or declines based on consultations with relevant AI actors, including affected communities, and field data about contextrelevant risks and trustworthiness characteristics are identified and documented.

programControlMapping.name: Measuring AI system performance
programControlMapping.description: AI system performance and reliability criteria are measured qualitatively or quantitatively as part of the ongoing system usage in production, and performance improvements are identified and implemented according to the company's product development lifecycle.

programPolicyMapping.title: AI Governance Policy
programPolicyMapping.description: Establish the objectives, practices, and governance around the use of Artificial Intelligence.

programPolicyMapping.title: AI Risk Management Policy
programPolicyMapping.description: A framework for managing AI risk at the company.
